FuncDef:
The snmp-agent command enables the SNMP agent function.
The undo snmp-agent command disables the SNMP agent function.
By default, the SNMP agent function is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable the SNMP agent function, run the snmp-agent command. The SNMP agent is an agent process on a device on the network. The SNMP agent maintains managed network devices by responding to NMS requests and reporting management data to the NMS. To configure SNMP on a device, the SNMP agent must be enabled.
The snmp-agent command opens SNMP port 161 for both IPv4 and IPv6 if the port is not opened.
Configuration Impact
Running the undo snmp-agent command causes the configurations of all SNMP versions (SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, and SNMPv3) on the device to become invalid.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
